name: Michelle Kerr

topics.topic_text: Why'd you settle in this dump?
topics.response_text: There's more to the 188 than meets the eye. Troops move back and forth on 93 all the time, and 95 is how NCR folks come and go from Vegas.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about Legion raids?
topics.response_text: Not much. I hear some folks got killed down by Nelson... or was it Novac? I don't know. If they come up this way, me and dad'll go someplace else.
Name's Michelle. My Dad and me run this store. His name's Samuel. I take the day shift and he takes nights.

topics.topic_text: Primm's safe now. I took care of those prisoners.
topics.response_text: That's nice. I suspect we'll stick around here, though. Business has been good.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to see what you have for sale.

topics.response_text: You do know these old roads were numbered, right? We're standing where the 95 and 93 meet. And 95 plus 93 equals... 188.
Welcome to the 188 Slop & Shop. How can I help you?

description:
Michelle Kerr is a 38 year-old Caucasian Female.

Michelle Kerr is a human merchant who operates at the 188 Trading Post in the Mojave Wasteland. She specializes in selling ammunition and shares her business operations with her partner, Samuel. Michelle is pragmatic and business-savvy, having adapted to the harsh realities of life in the wasteland.

Michelle Kerr's Personality: Michelle is pragmatic, business-minded, and cautious. She values self-sufficiency and is willing to relocate if her current situation becomes untenable. She maintains a neutral stance in the conflicts between factions, focusing primarily on her business interests.

Michelle Kerr's Backstory: Michelle Kerr's life in the Mojave Wasteland has been one of constant adaptation. Originally from a settlement that was threatened by Caesar's Legion, she and Samuel relocated to the 188 Trading Post several years ago. They've established a successful business there, with Michelle focusing on ammunition sales while Samuel handles food, alcohol, and weapon repairs. Michelle has learned to navigate the complexities of wasteland trade, maintaining neutrality while ensuring her and Samuel's survival. She's developed a keen sense for when to stay put and when it's time to move on.
